Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Bilateral Internal Iliac Artery Preservation in Aortoiliac Aneurysms

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were divided into groups based on aneurysm location and IIA preservation

Participants.evidence: 265 patients with aortoiliac aneurysms were enrolled from June 2019 to February 2024. Conducted at four tertiary hospitals in China

Intervention.evidence: Participants were divided into groups based on aneurysm location and IIA preservation: Group BB (bilateral aneurysms with bilateral IBSG), Group BU (bilateral aneurysms with unilateral IBSG and contralateral IIA embolization), Group UB (unilateral aneurysm with bilateral IIA preservation), and Group UU (unilateral aneurysm with unilateral IIA preservation)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the safety and efficacy of preserving bilateral internal iliac arteries (IIAs) using iliac branch stent grafts (IBSG) in patients with aortoiliac aneurysms

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was major adverse events, and the secondary outcome was pelvic ischemia

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Propensity score matching was used for comparison

Number_Randomised.evidence: 265 patients with aortoiliac aneurysms were enrolled from June 2019 to February 2024

Number_Analysed.evidence: After matching, 76 patients were in Group BB and BU, and 110 in Group UB and UU

Result_Outcome.evidence: Group BB had fewer cases of buttock claudication (1 vs. 10, p < 0.05) and decreased erectile function (2 vs. 12, p < 0.05) compared to Group BU
